message: in the last update of the ui, a vertical line was added but i dont see any vertical lines. What i needed was a thin white line(regardless of dark or light mode) that separates the of primary sidebar icons with the names of the icons to the left of it, and have the vertical line placed in the same place where the primary sidebar collapses to.

you do not have to launch npm start every time code is fixed, because i already have it running and compiled in real time. The problem is, that the white line awkwardly appears only when the primary sidebar in collapsed, and it doesn't show when sidebar is expanded. Also, the line is only visible in dark mode.

Okay, now the problem is that the line is too thick. Maybe what i wanted is a simple separation of icons from its text, and also vertical separation between icons, which is already well seen in dark mode(home, search, workspace icons are reparated from the app icons and then with the settings etc. icons vertically), and i also want the separation to be seen in light mode. With the most reasonable and natural code possible(permanent line seems too artificial)

The icon separators are positioned vertically well, but horizontally too far to the right from the icons. it should be seamlessly in the same position as the right end of the collapsed version of primary sidebar. Also, the icon separators are not vertically connected with each other, making them look like a dotted line. I want the all connected up and down.

Alright, now the line position seems to be almost perfect. One small fix remains. The line is very thin, but still seems 1px thicker to the right, compared to the collapsed version of the primary sidebar. Can it be adjusted?

Thanks. Now I've been experimenting by adjusting window size by dragging, and discovered that the settings page gets its vertical scrolling sidebar hidden when the window gets too narrow. I want it to always show on the right end when needed(but not when there is no content to scroll down). Also, the settings content boxes should have its min with but,I want it to decrease its width to fit the window when window width gets reduced. I want this kind of automatic size setting for all pages if possible.

It is for an unlikely situation, but it the window width gets too small, small enough to not show the page, the primary sidebar and the topbar seems to get affected, changing its width and icon position. I want them fixed regardless of the window size. And lastly, as a safety measure, put minimum window size restriction to protect layout.
something is wrong. the hamburger button is missing. the left portion of the topbar seems to be hidden below the primary sidebar

Okay now for small adjustments:
1. The vertical interval between Settings category boxes are too far. I want them placed more tightly.
2. Reduce text size of the author/version/license text of the help window to fit the size of the license text below.
3. Reduce the overall text/box, all the size of the profile page in general. Make them scalable with UI.
Tone down the font size of the overall profile page a bit(make the id, email, department font less bold, and also align them more to the left to fit the left end of the profile name box.
remove the line "License:...

remove the line "License:..." from the help window.
Also, i have an idea to reduce verical size of the settings category.
Instead of placing the dropdown bar under the title and explanation of the category, align it to the right end of the category box, only make sure the dropdown box and the text does not interfere with each other, by wrapping them in separate boxs(no margin than increases size! simply separate them halfway in the category box)

No need for running npm in the later responses.
Also, make all the settings category dropdown boxes horizontal size the same(fit to the smallest one)
And why is the settings page vertical scrollbar present even if there is no content to scroll down to? I want it to be only seen when there is more content below.

Make all the settings category dropdown boxes horizontal size the same(240px)
And why is the settings page vertical scrollbar present even if there is no content to scroll down to? I want it to be only seen when there is more content below.
Why did you remove the typography? roll it back
No I mean your removal of the typography variant... code crashed the whole app revert it!
